titles.title: A concurrent resolution to extend the life of the Joint Congressional Committee on Inaugural Ceremonies and the provisions of S. Con. Res. 93 and S. Con. Res. 94 of the One Hundred Eighth Congress.
A concurrent resolution to extend the life of the Joint Congressional Committee on Inaugural Ceremonies and the provisions of S. Con. Res. 93 and S. Con. Res. 94 of the One Hundred Eighth Congress.

vote.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Continues with the same power and authority in the 109th Congress: (1) the Joint Congressional Committee on Inaugural Ceremonies established in the 108th Congress; and (2) S. Con. Res. 93, adopted in the 108th Congress, which authorizes use of the rotunda of the U.S. Capitol in connection with the inauguration of the President-elect and the Vice President-elect.
